answers.answer: Dear hueck:  Unfortunately, some breast cancers will come back despite doing everything possible to prevent this from occurring.  In these cases, it is not anyone's fault - just bad luck.In general, diabetes and cancer are two separate conditions and unless the same organs are affected (kidneys for example) only the treatments, not the diseases, may interact.  For example, if you were to be put on steroids as part of a treatment protocol, your sugar level could rise as a result.  Some chemotherapies also affect the nerves in your hands and feet just like the diabetes can.  This might impact which treatments are chosen.  You need a good internist or endocrinologist who can follow your diabetes and work with an oncologist who can manage the cancer.
